result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvester Tremaine Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court does not object to Probation being terminated after 1 year if conditions are met.
Court notes 4 days credit against ultimate sentence.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: DA's office to check on money siezed and have that forwarded to the CofC Office and applied to costs. Any difference to be collected through DOC.

-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Kim D.
-Random and regular testing.
-Seek work/school and maintain work.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment or additional Assessments.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Sylvester Tremaine Jones appeared. Case called at 9:04. Includes 15CM98, 16CM114. Atty. Petros updates the court. ADA Hartung agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended  charge in 15CM98 to DC without a domestic inhancer and G to 16CM114. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended charge to DC without the domestic enhancer in 15CM98 (947.01) and guilty of 16CM114. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses 16CM33 which was previously dismissed and now is dismissed with prejudice.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
On 15CM98
60 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED.
Court notes 4 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 
18 months probation with conditions:
Court does not object to probation being terminated after a year if conditions have been met. 
- DE is to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with K. Denver the term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- AODA and any recommended follow through by agent or additional assessments.
- 15 hrs of community service.
- Random and regular testing.
- Seek and maintain work and seek work or school.
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Costs of $243.00
Apply bond on file
DA's office to check on money siezed and have them forwarded to the COC office to be credited. Any difference shall be paid through probation. 

On 16CM114
90 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED consecutive to 15CM98
- Costs of $243.00.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
Plea hearing on June 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

-Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kimberly D.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
